TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is a former lawyer who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE he was admitted to the bar and started to practice as a lawyer in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( NORP ) of ORG ( Rechtsanwaltskammer ) provisionally suspended the applicant 's right to practice and on DATE bankruptcy proceedings were opened against him . Taking note of that fact , on DATE ORG of ORG ( Ausschuß der Rechtsanwaltskammer ) decided that the applicant had lost his right to practise as a lawyer pursuant to section CARDINAL(CARDINALa ) of LAW ( ORG ) . This provision , as in force at that time , provided that the right to exercise the profession of a practising lawyer shall be revoked following the binding opening of bankruptcy proceedings until their binding termination and the final dismissal of a request to open bankruptcy proceedings for lack of sufficient means . It further appears that , in connection with the bankruptcy proceedings , the applicant was convicted of embezzlement by ORG on DATE and sentenced to DATE imprisonment and on DATE an additional sentence of DATE was imposed on him .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant asked ORG to strike him out of ORG ( PERSON ) for health reasons . On DATE ORG informed the applicant that it had taken note of his request . However , the Government submitted that the plenary assembly of ORG had struck the applicant out of the List of Lawyers on DATE . The applicant though submitted that no such decision had been taken by the plenary assembly .

CARDINAL . It appears that ORG continued to address invoices for membership fees ( including contributions to the pension fund ) to the applicant until DATE . The Government submitted that those requests were based on a clerical error by the ORG 's administration and that the respective invoices were subsequently declared void .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant made an application to ORG asking it to grant him an old - age pension . In his request he referred to the fact that he had practised as a lawyer DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE Division IV of ORG of ORG ( Ausschuß der Rechtsanwaltskammer ) dismissed the applicant 's application . It found that , under the relevant provisions of LAW , an old - age pension is granted to a lawyer when he or she reaches the retirement age , that is , sixtyfive DATE . However , he or she must also have renounced his or her right to practise as a lawyer . Given that , before he reached the retirement age , the applicant had already lost his right to practice as a lawyer , he was not entitled to an old - age pension .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed an objection ( PERSON ) . He submitted that the above - mentioned decision had been unlawful . If , however , the findings of ORG were correct , the regulations on the entitlement to an old - age pension were unconstitutional because the decision to refuse him a pension after he had paid contributions to the pension fund for DATE had been arbitrary .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Plenary of ORG rejected the objection . It observed that the bankruptcy proceedings which had been opened against the applicant were still pending and the applicant could not claim a pecuniary right without the consent of the receiver . Given that the applicant 's objections had been filed without the consent of the receiver , the objection had had to be rejected .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with ORG against the above - mentioned decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the Plenary decision of DATE . It found that a pension claim was not CARDINAL of the claims falling entirely under the list of assets which were subject to bankruptcy proceedings . Accordingly , the applicant himself had had the right to file an objection .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Plenary of ORG decided again on the applicant 's objection . It found that , under the relevant provisions of LAW , the person applying for the pension must , when reaching the retirement age , still be a member of ORG . Given that , before reaching the retirement age , the applicant had lost his membership of ORG because he had also lost his right to exercise his profession , he was not entitled to a pension .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with ORG in which he argued that the decision of ORG had violated the principle of equality and his right to peaceful enjoyment of his possessions . At the same time he also lodged a complaint with ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's complaint . It found that the applicant would have had a right to an old - age pension only if CARDINAL ) he had reached the retirement age and CARDINAL ) he had still been enrolled in the List of Lawyers of the Austrian Chamber of Lawyers at that time . While the applicant had met the first condition , he had not met the second condition because bankruptcy proceedings had been opened against him which had led ex lege to the applicant loosing his right to practice and , thereby , loosing his membership of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to deal with the applicant 's case because it would not have had any prospect of success .

CARDINAL . The rules governing the exercise of the profession of a lawyer are set out in LAW ( Rechtsanwaltsordnung ) . Section CARDINAL of LAW , as amended in DATE ( LAW ) , provided a lawyer with a right to an old - age pension , or , under certain conditions , for a pension for his or her surviving spouse or descendants . The main principles for pension schemes for lawyers are set out in section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW . According to these principles , only someone who is inscribed in the List of Lawyers of a regional ORG at the time that he or she reaches the retirement age is entitled to an old - age pension ; he or she must have been inscribed on the List for a period of DATE before reaching the retirement age ; the retirement age is fixed at DATE and upon reaching that age , a lawyer must renounce his or her right to exercise the profession . Further conditions are set out for pensions on account of incapacity to exercise the profession , widows ' or widowers ' pension and pensions for descendants . Under section ORG ) , the regional ORG are free to fix more favourable conditions for their own pension scheme .

CARDINAL . The detailed regulations , as set out in the statues of the pension schemes ( ORG ) adopted by the plenary assembly of ORG , repeat the conditions under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW . ORG has not made use of the possibility under LAW ) to fix more favourable rules with the exception of fixing the retirement age at DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP The pension scheme is financed by compulsory contributions from the members of the pension fund , the amount of which is fixed by the plenary assembly of ORG and roughly calculated on the basis of the payments to beneficiaries out of the pension fund .

CARDINAL . NORP The fund has also another source of income . Under NORP Law , lawyers do not receive individual payments for services rendered in the context of legal aid . However , as a compensation for the services rendered by all lawyers , the ORG pays an DATE lump sum which is divided among the regional ORG and put into the pension funds .

For DATE the contributions were fixed at ORG CARDINAL ( approximately ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) , reduced contributions for members DATE at ORG CARDINAL ( approximately EUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) and increased contributions for lawyers who were DATE when inscribed in the List of Lawyers for the first time at ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( approximately ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) . Pension payments for DATE were fixed at ORG CARDINAL ( approximately EUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) payable CARDINAL times per year . Pension payments were regularly increased over DATE and the amount fixed for DATE was ORG CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . By a federal act of DATE ( ORG I no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , which entered into force on DATE , the pension regime of lawyers was amended . The new system of old - age pensions , as provided for in sections DATE and CARDINAL of LAW , provides that being inscribed in the List of Lawyers at the time of reaching the retirement age is no longer a condition which must be met in order for an old - age pension to be granted . Old - age pensions are now also granted to persons formerly inscribed on the List of Lawyers and , provided that contributions have been made for a minimum time , they are calculated using a formula which takes into account the amount of contributions paid and the period during which they have been paid .
CARDINAL . On DATE , in an extraordinary meeting , the plenary assembly of ORG amended the statutes of its pension scheme following the introduction of the above - mentioned rules .

CARDINAL . Under the transitory provisions of section CARDINAL of the GPE statues of the pension scheme , the new provisions apply only to lawyers claiming an old - age pension whose right to exercise the profession had not been withdrawn before the amendment entered into force .
